list.s: While I did not attend the trial--I was lucky to be able to read your highly amusing and informative dispatches, several of which made me spit up my lunch laughing--it certainly seemed as if the image of Bill Gates took a beating and the insular culture of Microsoft did not look so good.
You want me to read out loud starting on 18?

Who can, for instance, blame a youth with but a mildly evil disposition from guffawing when he reads in Pater's Marius The Epicurean (Chapter V) a reference to Apuleius' The Golden Ass noting that “all through the book, there is an unmistakably real feeling for asses ...”
He read all the Great Books dutifully, racing to find out how each ended, annoyed at the peculiarities of style that made Stendhal different from Balzac or Homer from Virgil.
He reads German lit.
If you want to read it as it should be read, just reply to this email with "I want to read" in the subject heading.
